title: "Want to really live? Discover the power of NLP and Instant Rapport to unlock your potential"
first_phrase: This guide on Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) and related techniques is aimed at improving self-awareness, communication skills, and relationships. In the previous section, the importance of consciously driving the "Personal Bus" of one's own life was discussed, and the need to avoid being chained to the back seat by unconscious reactions was emphasized. The last part of the guide covers specific techniques such as anchoring, metaphors, time line, phobia techniques, and R.E.I. The aim of these techniques is to use the brain more efficiently and achieve a "natural state" of self-realization. The guide was compiled by students of the ISI-CNV institute, with special thanks to Erika Galati and Stefano Sesini.
content: How much ownership do we have of our thoughts? Many people are prisoners of their own brain. It’s as if they were chained to the back seat of the bus with someone else at the wheel. But who is this someone else? They are our unconscious reactions and plans. We are the ones who should be driving our “Personal Bus”. If we don’t give some directions, we will face the risk that we will either travel randomly on our own behalf, or other people will find the way to direct it in our place. NLP and the other methods that we present to you are a unique opportunity to learn how to use the brain in a more functional way. Neuro-linguistic programming is nothing more than an educational process, therefore, the other methods can open up the way to contact with that which we realize to be a “natural state”. Another interesting metaphor is the following: Let us imagine now that our brain is a machine that is missing an off switch. If we do not give it something to do, it will continue to churn around and at the end, it gets bored!!!!! How many of you are obsessed with particular thoughts or situations that you would like to resolve? Saying to yourselves, “I would like to be able to push them out of my head”. Think about the extraordinary ability that you have to able to put them there in the first place! Our point of view is that our brains are phenomenal.
last_phrase: In conclusion, NLP and the other methods explored in this text can help us improve our relationship with ourselves and others, overcome limitations and achieve our goals. By becoming aware of our unconscious plans and behavioral patterns, we can modify them as we wish and learn how to use our brains in a more functional way. Additionally, instant rapport techniques such as mirroring can help us establish positive relationships with others, leading to better communication and understanding. Ultimately, the decision to embark on this journey of personal growth and development lies with each individual.
